bug.author: kantuni
bug.summary: React throws an error message when About link is clicked
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
React throws the following error message when About link (dropdown menu) is clicked. Error: Tried to use SessionInfo before it was initialized <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6151409/71174471-b9ffe380-227e-11ea-985d-fa35b3ce2e7d.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
cd frontend; yarn start DO NOT streamlit run ... Go to localhost:3000 Open menu Click on the About link
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The error should be wrapped in an Error Boundary and show a nice modal. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
It shows React error message instead. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.51.0 Python version: 3.7.5 Using PipEnv OS version: macOS Catalina 10.15.2 Browser version: Firefox 71.0

comments.comment: I am also having this issue in streamlit 0.52 but it already happens when I run any streamlit app (even without any content), I pip installed streamlit 0.49 and now I don't experience this issue anymore.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/daviddemeij>@daviddemeij</denchmark-link> This is happening to me too with any app with version 0.52.0. Did not ever had this message pop up with prior streamlit versions. I opened a new bug <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/879>issue</denchmark-link> .

I can reproduce just by calling streamlit hello Using Anconda3 Python and using either Firefox or Chrome with following details
Streamlit version: 0.52.0 Python version: 3.7.4 Using PipEnv OS version: Windows 10
Browser versions:
Firefox 68.3 Chrome 79.0.3945.88
